metadata.feature_description: Mention users in articles and comments with @ notation and notifications

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Mention user in article via quick create dialog

steps.expected: Wiki page loads with article list and create article option
steps.actual: Wiki Test page loaded successfully showing 6 articles in the list

steps.action: Click Create article button to open article creation dialog
steps.expected: Article creation dialog opens with rich text editor supporting @ mentions
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with simple textarea field for content (not a rich text editor)

steps.action: Type @ symbol in content field to trigger mention autocomplete
steps.expected: Autocomplete dropdown should appear with list of available users to mention
steps.actual: No autocomplete dropdown appeared - the simple textarea does not support user mentions functionality

issues: The quick create article dialog uses a simple HTML textarea instead of a rich text editor (Redactor) that supports user mentions
Code review shows user mentions are initialized via dnn.social.initUserMentions() which requires the Redactor editor, but the quick create dialog does not use Redactor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access article detail page for editing with rich editor

steps.action: Click on existing article 'Test Article Draft' to access detail page
steps.expected: Article detail page loads with edit functionality and rich text editor
steps.actual: 404 Error Page - 'Sorry, the page you are looking for cannot be found'

issues: Wiki article detail pages return 404 errors - URLs like /en-us/Wiki-Test/Test-Article-Draft are not resolving
This prevents testing of user mentions in the full article editor which uses Redactor and has mention support
Articles appear in the list but their URLs are broken or the articles may have been deleted from the database while metadata remains

steps.action: Attempt to access article detail page to find comments section
steps.expected: Article page should load with comments section allowing @ mentions
steps.actual: Cannot test - article detail pages return 404 errors preventing access to comments section

issues: Unable to test comment mentions due to 404 errors on all article detail pages

steps.action: Type @ in quick create dialog content field
steps.expected: Autocomplete dropdown appears with users matching typed characters
steps.actual: No autocomplete functionality available in the simple textarea - quick create uses basic HTML textarea without mention support

issues: Quick create dialog does not have rich editor with mention autocomplete
Full article editor with mention support is inaccessible due to 404 errors on article pages

observations: Code review confirms User Mentions feature is implemented: ContentController.cs uses UserMentionsController.Instance.ReplaceUserMentionsWithProfileLink() to process mentions
UserMentionNotificationsController.Instance.SendUserMentionedNotification() is called when articles are published to notify mentioned users
The dnn.wiki.ContentEditor.js file shows dnn.social.initUserMentions() is called on the Redactor editor for both content and summary fields
The dnn.social.mentions.js plugin connects to Social/GetAvailableUsersForMentioning API endpoint for autocomplete data
The quick create article dialog (modal) uses a simple textarea, not the full Redactor editor, which explains why mentions don't work there
All wiki article detail page URLs return 404 errors - this is a critical issue preventing testing of the full editor and comments with mention support
The feature implementation appears correct in code but is untestable via UI due to the 404 errors on article pages
